title: A Guide to SQL Naming Conventions
description: One of Java’s big strengths, in my opinion, is the fact that most naming conventions have been established by the creators of the language. For example: Class names are in PascalCase Member names are in camelCase Constants are in SNAKE_CASE If someone does not adhere to these conventions, the resulting code quickly looks non-idiomatic. What …
